title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions until al dente.
While the spaghetti is cooking, whisk together the eggs, cheese, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy.
Add the garlic to the skillet and cook until fragrant.
Remove the skillet from the heat and add the cooked spaghetti, tossing to coat in the bacon fat.
Add the egg mixture to the skillet and toss to combine, allowing the residual heat to cook the eggs and create a creamy sauce.
Serve the spaghetti carbonara hot with additional cheese and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
In a large bowl, combine the yogurt, lemon juice, cumin, paprika, turmeric, coriander, cinnamon, cayenne pepper, ginger, and garlic.
Add the chicken to the bowl and toss to coat in the marinade.
Thread the chicken onto skewers and grill for 6-7 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
In a large skillet, combine the crushed tomatoes and heavy cream over medium heat.
Add the grilled chicken to the skillet and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Season the chicken tikka masala with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the chicken tikka masala hot over rice, garnished with fresh cilantro.

title: Chicken Alfredo
summary: A simple and ultra comforting homemade Chicken Alfredo recipe.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Cook the fettuccine according to the package instructions until al dente.
While the fettuccine is cooking, season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken breasts to the skillet and cook for 6-7 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
Add the garlic to the skillet and cook until fragrant.
Add the heavy cream to the skillet and bring to a simmer.
Stir in the Parmesan cheese until melted and the sauce has thickened.
Slice the chicken breasts and add them back to the skillet, tossing to coat in the sauce.
Serve the chicken Alfredo hot over the cooked fettuccine, garnished with fresh parsley.

title: Chicken Parmesan
summary: A classic Italian-American dish of crispy chicken cutlets topped with marinara sauce and melted mozzarella.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Dredge the chicken breasts in the flour, shaking off any excess.
In a shallow bowl, beat the eggs.
In another shallow bowl, combine the breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheese.
Dip the floured chicken breasts in the beaten eggs, then coat in the breadcrumb mixture.
Place the breaded chicken breasts on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes, or until cooked through.
Remove the chicken from the oven and top each breast with marinara sauce and mozzarella cheese.
Return the chicken to the oven and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve the chicken Parmesan hot, garnished with fresh basil.

title: Chicken Fried Rice
summary: A quick and easy weeknight meal made with leftover rice, chicken, and whatever veggies you have on hand!
instructions: Heat the sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken breasts to the skillet and cook for 6-7 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the mixed vegetables and garlic, and cook until the vegetables are tender.
Push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and scramble the eggs on the other side.
Add the cooked rice to the skillet and toss to combine with the vegetables and eggs.
Slice the cooked chicken breasts and add them back to the skillet.
Stir in the soy sauce and oyster sauce, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the chicken fried rice hot, garnished with green onions.

title: Chicken Noodle Soup
summary: A classic comfort food made with chicken, vegetables, and egg noodles in a flavorful broth.
ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breast or thighs
instructions: In a large pot or Dutch oven, sauté the chopped onion, carrots, and celery in olive oil until softened.
Add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
Add the chicken broth, bay leaf, and chicken breasts to the pot.
Bring the broth to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
Remove the chicken from the pot and shred it with two forks.
Return the shredded chicken to the pot and add the egg noodles.
Simmer the soup for an additional 10 minutes, or until the noodles are cooked.
Season the chicken noodle soup with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the chicken noodle soup hot, garnished with fresh parsley.

title: Chicken Enchiladas
summary: A delicious and easy Mexican dish made with shredded chicken, cheese, and enchilada sauce.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, combine the shredded chicken, 1/2 cup of the cheese, diced green chilies, and chopped cilantro.
Season the chicken mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
Pour 1/4 cup of the enchilada sauce into the bottom of a baking dish.
Warm the corn tortillas in the microwave for 30 seconds to make them pliable.
Divide the chicken mixture evenly among the tortillas and roll them up.
Place the rolled enchiladas seam-side down in the baking dish.
Pour the remaining enchilada sauce over the top of the enchiladas and sprinkle with the remaining cheese.
Bake the enchiladas for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve the chicken enchiladas hot, garnished with fresh cilantro.
